summary:
North Africa is a region in the northern part of the African continent. It includes countries like Algeria, Egypt, Libya, Morocco, Tunisia, and Western Sahara. The United Nations also includes Sudan in this region.

People have lived here since ancient times, including Berbers and Egyptians. In the 7th and 8th centuries, Arabs from the Arabian Peninsula arrived, bringing Islam and influencing the culture. This mix of cultures has shaped North Africa's identity, which is also linked to the Middle East. The region is mostly Muslim and Arab, with a rich history dating back to the Neolithic era.
title: North Africa
